channel.description: In this chapter we discussed the Windows Message Loop and Queue, and how messages provided to this loop are transformed into C# events by the Application class. We examined C#â€™s approach to events, which is a more flexible form of message passing. We learned how to write both C# event listeners and handlers, and how to invoke event handlers with Invoke(). We also learned how to create and trigger our own custom events with custom event arguments.
